alert.note: Alert for Olmsted (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 12 at 11:30PM CDT until April 13 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN WINONA...SOUTHEASTERN OLMSTED AND NORTHEASTERN FILLMORE COUNTIES... At 1129 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms capable of producing tornadoes were located along a line extending from Chatfield to Lanesboro, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. These dangerous storms will be near... Rushford around 1140 PM CDT. Lewiston around 1150 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these tornadic storms include Saratoga, Arendahl, Rushford Village, Whalan, County Roads 6 And 33, Pilot Mound and Highway 30 And County 74. This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 235 and 245. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
